diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis, late-onset infantile subtype (Janský–Bielschowsky disease)
differential_diagnosis: GM1 and GM2 gangliosidoses (Tay-Sachs disease and Sandhoff's disease)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was based on the patient's age of onset, clinical presentation including seizures and visual disturbances (cherry-red spots), and the presence of membrane-bound curvilinear bodies in muscle biopsy. The absence of significant peripheral nerve involvement and normal cerebrospinal fluid protein levels helped rule out other potential diagnoses.
